keyMoments.moment: Demonstrates Conqueror's Haki on Whitebeard's ship
keyMoments.significance: Shows the immense power of his Haki, causing multiple Whitebeard Pirates to faint

keyMoments.moment: Reveals origin of facial scar from Blackbeard
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Blackbeard as a serious threat who scarred a Yonko before gaining Devil Fruit powers

keyMoments.moment: Requests Whitebeard stop Ace's pursuit of Blackbeard
keyMoments.significance: Central purpose of the meeting; foreshadows the Marineford War

keyMoments.moment: Clashes with Whitebeard, splitting the sky
keyMoments.significance: First sky-splitting clash in the anime, demonstrating the godlike power of Yonko

abilities.name: Conqueror's Haki
abilities.description: Supreme King Haki strong enough to knock out multiple people and split the sky when clashed with another Conqueror's Haki user

relationships.description: Mutual respect between fellow Yonko despite being on opposing sides
Shanks was scarred by Blackbeard and recognizes him as a dangerous threat
Shanks is concerned about Ace's pursuit of Blackbeard

names.japanese: エドワード・ニューゲート

keyMoments.moment: Meets with Shanks on the Moby Dick
keyMoments.significance: Rare meeting between two Yonko that the World Government tried to prevent

keyMoments.moment: Discusses shared history with Shanks and Gol D. Roger
keyMoments.significance: Provides context about the previous generation of pirates and the 22 years since Roger's death

keyMoments.moment: Refuses to stop Ace from pursuing Blackbeard
keyMoments.significance: Critical decision that sets in motion the events leading to the Marineford War

keyMoments.moment: Clashes with Shanks, splitting the sky
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates his immense power as one of the Yonko

abilities.name: Conqueror's Haki
abilities.description: Advanced Conqueror's Haki capable of splitting the sky when clashed with Shanks

relationships.description: Mutual respect between fellow Yonko with shared history from Roger era
Views Ace as a beloved son and refuses to stop his pursuit of Blackbeard
Former crew member who killed Thatch; Whitebeard wants him to pay for his crime
Whitebeard considers Thatch a son and seeks to avenge his death

keyMoments.significance: Orders newcomers to go inside as Shanks boards the ship
Recognizes and acknowledges the power of Shanks' Conqueror's Haki

keyMoments.moment: Begins construction of the Straw Hats' new ship with Iceberg
keyMoments.significance: Starts building what will become the Thousand Sunny

relationships.description: Working together to build the Straw Hats' new ship

keyMoments.moment: Joins Franky in constructing the Straw Hats' ship
keyMoments.significance: The master shipwright assists in building the future Thousand Sunny

relationships.description: Working together to build the Straw Hats' new ship

keyMoments.moment: Discovers Luffy spent all 100 million berries
keyMoments.significance: Frustrated about the lack of funds for ship furnishings, highlighting her role as financial manager

keyMoments.moment: Suspects Aokiji's involvement in protecting Franky Family
keyMoments.significance: Shows her analytical thinking about the World Government's manipulation of information

relationships.description: Robin suspects Aokiji may have helped protect the Franky Family from being blamed
